intro: Hieracium nigrescens subsp. mutilescens, commonly known as the black hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, and it produces small, dry fruits called achenes. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
